item.description:
Cold weather is the best time to enjoy hot-pot cooking, of which the Japanese shabu-shabu tradition is one of the tastiest examples. Diners cook their food selections at the table in a pot of hot broth. It's friendly, fun, and a great way to escape into a culture that doesn't celebrate Christmas for an evening!

The new Shabu Zen branch in Allston has a parking lot in back, which should make things more convenient than other shabu places in greater Boston. Kimonos optional.

I can expand the reservation somewhat to include additional people, and I can also veto unpaid RSVPs, so please pay your reservation fee to keep your spot! And please join the waiting list if you are interested in this event. I will try to get you in and notify you one way or the other.
item.name: Sake, Sapporo, and Shabu-shabu!
